bibl.title: An Ostracon from the Christian Hermitage in MMA 1152.
bibl.note: Ostracon found in in a mud-brick tower built in front of the entrance to a Middle Kingdom tomb adapted for use as a hermitage (TT 1152). 6th-mid 7th century. The ostracon contained at least six texts, including a series of Greek quotations, either direct or indirect, coming mostly from the Bible, Christian texts and a diagram explaining how Coptic cryptography works.
